intro: Gastrochilus gongshanensis, commonly known as the Gongshan gastrochilus, is a rare orchid species native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive floral morphology, featuring showy, fragrant flowers with a unique coloration pattern. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often on forest floors or among rocky substrates. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to conserve moisture in its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native region.
